result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty Bergner states that his client will be taking part in an ATR for 4 months and cannot have any ongoing hearings during this time period.
Atty Bergner would ask that this be set out for 4 months.
Letters had been filed by both ADA Dodge and Atty Bergner.
ADA Jambois does not object to the defendant not appearing at this pretrial conference and would ask that the pretrial conference be set.
Court questions if the State has complied with victim notification statutes.
ADA Jambois checks to see if that has been completed and does not see that the victim has given any input.
Court will proceed with the PTC for September 6, 2022.

4:02 PM Defendant James A. Folmer appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for James A. Folmer.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Jedidiah J Dodge or State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Bergner was not able to complete the written waiver.
]Judge Zell does the preliminary hearing colloquy.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
